pageContext.claim: “And then they asked her about the Green New Deal. 'I love it.' They said, 'Yeah, but you don't allow airplanes anymore so you can't get to Hawaii.' 'Oh, we have to work on something.' So somebody jokingly said, 'We'll build a train to Hawaii,' and she actually thought it was a decent idea.”
pageContext.analysis: This supposed television exchange concerning Sen. Mazie Hirono (D-Hawaii) did not take place. Hirono was a co-sponsor of the resolution. "What the Green New Deal stands for is a recognition that climate change is happening and not sticking our head in the sand," she said. "So what's really crazy is Trump and all his minions and his ilk who think that global warming and climate change is not happening and they just stick their heads in the sand."
